resources.string: The sampler allows previewing audio, adjusting pitch and tempo, editing ADSR envelope, reverb, EQ and compression. Use the tabs to switch sections.

On the top of the sampler lay the control bar:
- Play / Pause: preview the sample
- Save: persist project data
- Pitch selectors: change the pitch
- BPM selector: change the beat per minute
- Time signature selector: change the beat display on the timeline

Use the ADSR editor to shape how a note evolves over time: Attack sets how quickly the sound reaches full volume, Decay is the time to falls at the Sustain level, Sustain is the steady level while the note is held, and Release is the time to fade after release.

Reverb simulates room reflections. Wet controls how much of the reverberated sound is mixed with the original sound, Size to set the perceived room size, Width and Depth to shape the stereo field, and Predelay to offset the onset of reflections.

Use the EQ faders to boost or cut specific frequency bands. Drag the vertical fader up to boost (positive dB) or down to cut (negative dB). Typical workflow: remove unwanted low rumble, gently shape mids, and add clarity with high band boosts.

Compressor reduces the dynamic range. Threshold sets the level above which compression occurs, Ratio sets the amount of gain reduction, Knee smooths the transition, Attack/Decay control timing, and Make-up Gain compensates for level loss.
